events.title: Britain Declares War on Germany
events.description: Following Germany's invasion of Belgium, the United Kingdom declares war on Germany, marking its entry into World War I.
events.significance: This declaration expanded World War I and brought significant global involvement into the conflict.

events.title: George Washington Orders the Evacuation of British Troops from Boston
events.description: During the American Revolutionary War, George Washington orders British forces to evacuate Boston after the Siege of Boston proves successful for the Americans.
events.significance: The evacuation marked an important early victory for the American forces and boosted morale.

events.title: The Gulf of Tonkin Resolution is Passed
events.description: The U.S. Congress passes the Gulf of Tonkin Resolution, allowing the President to increase U.S. military involvement in Vietnam without a formal declaration of war.
events.significance: This resolution significantly escalated the Vietnam War and impacted U.S. foreign policy.

events.title: Thomas Edison Invents the Practical Incandescent Light Bulb
events.description: Thomas Edison tests a filament that lasts over 40 hours, making the incandescent light bulb practical for widespread use.
events.significance: This invention revolutionized indoor lighting and had a profound impact on society and industry.

events.title: Harambe, Oldest Known Gorilla, Born in Captivity
events.description: Harambe, a Western lowland gorilla, is born in captivity, later becoming famous worldwide.
events.significance: Harambe's story raised global awareness about gorilla conservation and animal rights.
